title: Gregg Popvich to replace Mike Krzyzewski as USA basketball coach
text:
Gregg Popvich to replace Mike Krzyzewski as USA basketball coach Resize Text By Matt Bonesteel October 23 at 12:50 PM Follow @MattBonesteel (Andy Lyons/Getty Images) 
San Antonio Spurs Coach Gregg Popovich will replace Mike Krzyzewski as coach of the U.S. national men’s basketball team starting in 2017 and running through the 2020 Tokyo Olympics, USA Basketball announced Friday . 
Krzyzewski, the Duke coach who led Team USA to gold medals at the 2008 and 2012 Olympics, will become a special adviser to the team following the 2016 Rio Games. On Monday , he announced he would step down from the position after the next Olympics. 
Team USA currently is on a 63-game winning streak that dates to 2006. 
“I’m extremely humbled and honored to have the opportunity to represent our country as the coach of the USA National Team,” Popovich said in a statement. “What the program has accomplished over the last decade under the leadership of [USA Basketball Chairman] Jerry Colangelo and Mike Krzyzewski is truly impressive. I will do my utmost to maintain the high standards of success, class and character established by Jerry, Coach K and the many players who have sacrificed their time on behalf of USA Basketball.” 
Popovich, 66, has led the Spurs to five NBA titles and has the third-best winning percentage in NBA history. He served as an assistant to Larry Brown on the 2004 U.S. Olympic team that earned a bronze medal.
